Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.lovelacetech.server.controller.BaseController
      • io.lovelacetech.server.controller.UserController

  • @RestController
 @CrossOrigin
 @RequestMapping(value="/api/secure/users")
public class UserController
extends BaseController

    • Method Detail

      • getUsers

        @RequestMapping(value="/",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserListApiResponse getUsers(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                            io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser)
        GET /api/secure/users/

        Gets all the Users in the database and returns in a list.

        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": {
     "users": [User]
   }
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be SUPER to access this endpoint.

         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be an authenticated User to access this endpoint.

      • updateProfileForAuthenticatedUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/updateProfile",
                method=POST)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse updateProfileForAuthenticatedUser(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                               io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                               @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                               io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser userUpdate)
        POST /api/secure/users/updateProfile

        Updates the authenticated user's profile with the following body:
        REQUEST BODY: 
         {
    (optional) "email": String,
    (optional) "username": String,
    (optional) "firstName": String,
    (optional) "lastName": String,
    (optional) "phoneNumber": String
 }


        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be an authenticated User to access this endpoint.

      • modifyUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/modifyUser",
                method=POST)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse modifyUser(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                     io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                     @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                     io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser userUpdate)
        POST /api/secure/users/modifyUser

        Updates another user's profile. This is only accessible to ADMIN users.
        REQUEST BODY: 
         {
    (required) "id": User.id,
    (optional) "email": String,
    (optional) "username": String,
    (optional) "firstName": String,
    (optional) "lastName": String,
    (optional) "phoneNumber": String,
    (optional) "accessLevel": {USER|ADMIN|SUPER}
 }


        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be an authenticated User with at least ADMIN privileges to access this endpoint.

      • getUsersForAdmin

        @RequestMapping(value="/forAdmin",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserListApiResponse getUsersForAdmin(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                            io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser)
        GET /api/secure/users/forAdmin

        Gets all the users for this authenticated Admin user. That is to say, gets all the users that belong to this Admin's company.

        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": {
     "users": [User]
   }
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be ADMIN or above to access this endpoint.

      • addUserToLocation

        @RequestMapping(value="/addToLocation/{userId}/{locationId}",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse addUserToLocation(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                                    io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                                    @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                    java.util.UUID userId,
                                                                                                                                                                                    @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                    java.util.UUID locationId)
        GET /api/secure/users/addToLocation/{userId}/{locationId}

        Adds a User to a location. That is to say, this endpoint gives the User with "userId" permission to access the Location with "locationId". This endpoint is accessible only to SUPER and ADMIN users. If the calling user does not have access to either the User or Location identified by userId and locationId respectively, "ACCESS_DENIED" will be thrown.

        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be ADMIN or above to access this endpoint.

      • addUserToLocations

        @RequestMapping(value="/addToLocations/{userId}",
                method=POST)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse addUserToLocations(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                          io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                          @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                          java.util.UUID userId,
                                                                                                                                                                          @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                          io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiLocationIdList locationIdList)
        POST /api/secure/users/addToLocations/{userId}

        Adds a User to multiple location. That is to say, this endpoint gives the User with "userId" permission to access the Locations with ids in the body array "locationIds". This endpoint is accessible only to SUPER and ADMIN users. If the calling user does not have access to either the User or Location identified by userId and locationId respectively, "ACCESS_DENIED" will be thrown.

        REQUEST BODY: 
         {
   "locationIds": [ locationId1, locationId2, ... ]
 }
        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be ADMIN or above to access this endpoint.

      • removeUserFromLocation

        @RequestMapping(value="/removeFromLocation/{userId}/{locationId}",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse removeUserFromLocation(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                                              io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                                              @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                              java.util.UUID userId,
                                                                                                                                                                                              @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                              java.util.UUID locationId)
        GET /api/secure/users/removeFromLocation/{userId}/{locationId}

        Adds a User to a location. That is to say, this endpoint removes the User with "userId" permissions to access the Location with "locationId". This endpoint is accessible only to SUPER and ADMIN users. If the calling user does not have access to either the User or Location identified by userId and locationId respectively, "ACCESS_DENIED" will be thrown.

        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be ADMIN or above to access this endpoint.

      • removeUserFromLocations

        @RequestMapping(value="/removeFromLocations/{userId}",
                method=POST)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse removeUserFromLocations(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                                    io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                                    @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                    java.util.UUID userId,
                                                                                                                                                                                    @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                    io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiLocationIdList locationIdList)
        POST /api/secure/users/removeFromLocations/{userId}

        Removes a User to multiple location. That is to say, this endpoint removes the User with "userId" permissions to access the Locations with ids in the body array "locationIds". This endpoint is accessible only to SUPER and ADMIN users. If the calling user does not have access to either the User or Location identified by userId and locationId respectively, "ACCESS_DENIED" will be thrown.

        REQUEST BODY: 
         {
   "locationIds": [ locationId1, locationId2, ... ]
 }
        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be ADMIN or above to access this endpoint.

      • setUserToLocations

        @RequestMapping(value="/setToLocations/{userId}",
                method=POST)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse setUserToLocations(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                          io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                          @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                          java.util.UUID userId,
                                                                                                                                                                          @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                          io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiLocationIdList locationIdList)
        POST /api/secure/users/setToLocations/{userId}

        Sets a User to multiple location. That is to say, this endpoint set the User with "userId" permissions to access the only the Locations with ids in the body array "locationIds". This endpoint is accessible only to SUPER and ADMIN users. If the calling user does not have access to either the User or Location identified by userId and locationId respectively, "ACCESS_DENIED" will be thrown.

        REQUEST BODY: 
         {
   "locationIds": [ locationId1, locationId2, ... ]
 }
        RESULT: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be ADMIN or above to access this endpoint.

      • deleteUser

        @RequestMapping(value="/{userId}",
                method=DELETE)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.user.UserApiResponse deleteUser(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                     io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                     @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                     java.util.UUID userId)
        DELETE /api/secure/users/{userId}

        Deletes the user with id "userId". Only an {Admin|Super} can delete users, and if the user is Admin, they can only delete users at the same company.
        The result body includes the deleted User object.



        RESULT: 

         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": success,
   "response": User
 }

        PERMISSIONS
        User must be ADMIN or above to access this endpoint.
